required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 2 Study of Gemcitabine or Gemcitabine + Enzastaurin in Participants With Advanced or Metastatic Pancreatic Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-Label Phase 2 Study of 2 Regimens, Gemcitabine Plus Enzastaurin and Single-Agent Gemcitabine, in Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Pancreatic Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to determine the effects and toxicity of gemcitabine alone or gemcitabine plus enzastaurin in participants with pancreatic cancer.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to the date of death from any cause up to 27.7 months
primary_outcome.description: OS was the duration from randomization to death. OS was censored at the last contact for participants who were alive, at the cut-off date.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) (Response Rate)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to measured progressive disease (PD) up to 19.9 months
secondary_outcome.description: Response rate was defined as percentage of responders (best study response recorded as CR or PR) from the qualified number of participants for tumor response analysis. Response defined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST, v1.0) criteria: CR was disappearance of all target lesions for at least 4 weeks. PR was at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum of LD. Percentage of participants was calculated as: (The number of responders with CR or PR/ The number of participants qualified for tumor response analysis) × 100.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to measured PD or death from any cause up to 21.6 months
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time from the date of randomization to the first date of documented progressive disease (PD) or death due to any cause, whichever occurred first. PFS was censored at the date of the last assessment visit for participants who were still alive at data cut-off and who had not had documented progressive disease. Participants who started a new treatment before progression were censored as of the date of the start of new treatment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of response to PD or death from any cause up to 19.9 months
secondary_outcome.description: The duration of a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) was defined, using the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST v1.0) criteria, as the time from first objective status assessment of CR or PR to the first time of disease progression or death as a result of any cause. Using the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST V1.0) criteria, CR was defined as the disappearance of all tumor lesions. PR was defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum of LD. Duration of response was censored at the date of the last assessment visit for responders who were still alive at data cut-off and had no documented progressive disease (PD).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Scores From Baseline (Improved, Stable or Worsened) to End of Study in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy Hepatobiliary Version 4 ( FACT-Hep v.4) (Quality of Life (QOL))
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through end of study up to 27.7 months
secondary_outcome.description: FACT-Hep consists of 45 items in five subscales (1) physical well-being (PWB) score rage 0 -28; (2) social well-being (SWB) score range 0-28; (3) emotional well-being (EWB) score range 0-24; (4) functional well-being (FWB) score range 0-28; and (5) the hepatobiliary cancer subscale (HCS) Score range 0-72. The Trial Outcomes Index (TOI) is the sum of the PWB, FWB and Hep subscales with a scores range of 0 to 128. The Total FACT-Hep score was the sum of all questions with a scores range of 0 to 180. The Total FACT-G score was the sum of the 27 questions in the PWB, SFWB, EWB and FWB with a scores range of 0 to 108. The FACT-Hep Symptoms Index with 8 key questions and scores range of 0 to 32 from the Hep Subscale. Higher score in sub-score or total score indicates better QOL and better health state. Participants were classified as "Improved" if they had positive change from baseline, "Worsened" if they had negative change from baseline, and "Stable" otherwise.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationship of Steady-State Drug Levels to Clinical Outcomes of Overall Survival (OS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to date of death from any cause up to 27.7 months
secondary_outcome.description: OS was the duration from randomization to death from any cause. For participants who were alive at data cut-off, OS was censored at the last contact. Participants were categorized into 2 groups based on their steady state drug levels of Enzastaurin (total analyte=enzastaurin + LSN326020 [metabolite]): those participants below the median and those participants above the median [2786.042 nanomoles per /liter (nmol/l)]. The steady state drug levels and clinical outcomes were not evaluated for the Gemcitabine only treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationship of Steady-state Drug Levels to Best Overall Response of Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), or Stable Disease (SD) (Disease Control)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Beginning of treatment up to 27.7 months
secondary_outcome.description: The overall disease control rate was calculated as percent of participants with overall response of complete response (CR), partial response (PR) or stable disease (SD) over number of per-protocol population. Using the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST v1.0) criteria, CR: disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; PR: as at least a 30% decrease in sum of longest diameter (LD) of target lesions; progressive disease (PD) was defined as at least 20% increase in sum of LD of target lesions; SD: small changes that did not meet above criteria. Participants were categorized into 2 groups based on their steady state drug levels of Enzastaurin (total analyte=enzastaurin + LSN326020 [metabolite]): participants below the median and participants above the median [2754.521 nanomoles per liter (nmol/l)]. The steady state drug levels and clinical outcomes were not evaluated for the Gemcitabine only group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Carbohydrate Antigen 19-9 (CA 19-9) Concentration in the Blood
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycles 1 to 6, and post-treatment (up to 27.7 months)
secondary_outcome.description: CA19-9 is a tumor biomarker which was measured in the blood to assess the effect of treatment with enzastaurin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) and Adverse Events (AEs) (Toxicity)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through study completion (Up To 27.7 Months)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically significant events were defined as SAEs and other non-serious adverse events (AEs). Participants who died due to progressive disease (PD), AEs while on treatment or died during the 30 day post-treatment are included. A summary of SAEs and other non-serious AEs regardless of causality is located in the Reported Adverse Events module.

intervention.description: 1200 milligrams (mg) loading dose then 500 mg, orally, daily, six 28-day cycles
1000 milligrams/square meter (mg/m^2), intravenously on Days 1, 8 and 15 per cycle, six 28-day cycles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of adenocarcinoma of the pancreas.
- Pretreatment tumor specimen must be available.
- No prior chemotherapy immunotherapy, biological therapy, or hormonal therapy for pancreatic cancer, including 5-fluorouracil (5-FU) with radiation therapy.
- Prior radiation allowed.
- Ability to stop some types of anti-seizure medicines within 14 days of enrollment.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Endocrine pancreatic tumor or ampullary cancer.
- Central Nervous System (CNS) metastases.
- Inability to swallow tablets.
- 10% or greater weight loss over the 6 weeks before study entry.

overall_official.last_name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon - Fri 9 AM - 5 PM Eastern time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST)

facility.name: For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559), Mon - Fri, 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST) or speak with your personal physician

reference.citation: Yount S, Cella D, Webster K, Heffernan N, Chang C, Odom L, van Gool R. Assessment of patient-reported clinical outcome in pancreatic and other hepatobiliary cancers: the FACT Hepatobiliary Symptom Index. J Pain Symptom Manage. 2002 Jul;24(1):32-44.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participant flow reports those participants who discontinued from study drug.

group.title: Enzastaurin+Gemcitabine
group.description: Enzastaurin: 1200 milligrams (mg) administered orally (as three 400-mg doses) after a meal on Day 1, then 500 mg orally, daily (as five 100-mg tablets) after lunch on Days 2 to 28 in Cycle 1, then 500 mg orally, daily (as five 100-mg tablets) after lunch on Days 1 to 28 in Cycle 2 and later. Gemcitabine: 1000 milligrams/square meter (mg/m^2) administered intravenously on Days 1, 8 and 15 of each 28-day cycle.

group.title: Gemcitabine
group.description: Gemcitabine: 1000 milligrams/square meter (mg/m^2) administered intravenously on Days 1, 8 and 15 of each 28-day cycle.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status
measure.description: [1] ECOG is a scale of participants activity Status 0 - Fully Active - Ambulatory, Restricted Strenuous Activity - Ambulatory, No Work Activities

measure.title: Diagnosis Stage
measure.description: Stage means how big the tumor is and how far it has spread. Stages range from 0 (not spread) to IV (spread throughout the body). Stage IIA -The tumor is outside pancreas but not in large blood vessels or lymph nodes; Stage IIB: Cancer in or outside pancreas but not in large blood vessels; spread to nearby lymph nodes. Stage III - The tumor is outside pancreas and spread to nearby large blood vessels or major nerves. May or may not have spread to nearby lymph nodes; not spread to distant sites. Stage IV - the cancer has spread to other organs of the body such as the lung, brain, or liver.

measure.title: Current Stage
measure.description: Stage means how big the tumor is and how far it has spread. Stages range from 0 (not spread) to IV (spread throughout the body). Stage IIB: Cancer in or outside pancreas but not in large blood vessels; spread to nearby lymph nodes. Stage III - The tumor is outside pancreas and spread to nearby large blood vessels or major nerves. May or may not have spread to nearby lymph nodes; not spread to distant sites. Stage IV - the cancer has spread to other organs of the body such as the lung, brain, or liver.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: OS was the duration from randomization to death. OS was censored at the last contact for participants who were alive, at the cut-off date.

outcome.population: Intent-to -treat (ITT) population: All randomized participants. Participants censored: Enzastaurin+Gemcitabine = 17; Gemcitabine = 11.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) (Response Rate)
outcome.description: Response rate was defined as percentage of responders (best study response recorded as CR or PR) from the qualified number of participants for tumor response analysis. Response defined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST, v1.0) criteria: CR was disappearance of all target lesions for at least 4 weeks. PR was at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum of LD. Percentage of participants was calculated as: (The number of responders with CR or PR/ The number of participants qualified for tumor response analysis) × 100.
outcome.time_frame: Randomization to measured progressive disease (PD) up to 19.9 months
outcome.population: Per Protocol Population: Randomized participants who had: 1) histological or cytological diagnosis of locally advanced (Stage II, III) or metastatic (Stage IV) adenocarcinoma of the pancreas; 2) no concurrent systemic chemotherapy; 3) presence of measurable disease at baseline; and 4) received at least 1 dose of study drug.

outcome.title: Duration of Response
outcome.description: The duration of a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) was defined, using the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST v1.0) criteria, as the time from first objective status assessment of CR or PR to the first time of disease progression or death as a result of any cause. Using the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST V1.0) criteria, CR was defined as the disappearance of all tumor lesions. PR was defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum of LD. Duration of response was censored at the date of the last assessment visit for responders who were still alive at data cut-off and had no documented progressive disease (PD).
outcome.time_frame: Time of response to PD or death from any cause up to 19.9 months
outcome.population: Participants in the Per Protocol population with a CR or PR: With histological or cytological diagnosis of locally advanced adenocarcinoma of the pancreas; no concurrent systemic chemotherapy; presence of measurable disease at baseline; and treatment with at least 1 dose of study drug. Censored: Enzastaurin+Gemcitabine = 1; Gemcitabine = 0.

Using the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST V1.0) criteria, CR was defined as the disappearance of all tumor lesions. outcome.title: Change in Scores From Baseline (Improved, Stable or Worsened) to End of Study in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy Hepatobiliary Version 4 ( FACT-Hep v.4) (Quality of Life (QOL))
outcome.description: FACT-Hep consists of 45 items in five subscales (1) physical well-being (PWB) score rage 0 -28; (2) social well-being (SWB) score range 0-28; (3) emotional well-being (EWB) score range 0-24; (4) functional well-being (FWB) score range 0-28; and (5) the hepatobiliary cancer subscale (HCS) Score range 0-72. The Trial Outcomes Index (TOI) is the sum of the PWB, FWB and Hep subscales with a scores range of 0 to 128. The Total FACT-Hep score was the sum of all questions with a scores range of 0 to 180. The Total FACT-G score was the sum of the 27 questions in the PWB, SFWB, EWB and FWB with a scores range of 0 to 108. The FACT-Hep Symptoms Index with 8 key questions and scores range of 0 to 32 from the Hep Subscale. Higher score in sub-score or total score indicates better QOL and better health state. Participants were classified as "Improved" if they had positive change from baseline, "Worsened" if they had negative change from baseline, and "Stable" otherwise.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline through end of study up to 27.7 months
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug and had data for FACT-Hep questionnaire.

group.title: Enzastaurin+Gemcitabine
group.description: Enzastaurin: 1200 milligrams (mg) administered orally (as three 400-mg doses) after a meal on Day 1, then 500 mg orally, daily (as five 100-mg tablets) after lunch on Days 2 to 28 in Cycle 1, then 500 mg orally, daily (as five 100-mg tablets) after lunch on Days 1 to 28 in Cycle 2 and later. Gemcitabine: 1000 milligrams/square meter (mg/m^2) administered intravenously on Days 1, 8 and 15 of each 28-day cycle.

The Total FACT-G score was the sum of the 27 questions in the PWB, SFWB, EWB and FWB with a scores range of 0 to 108. Participants were classified as "Improved" if they had positive change from baseline, "Worsened" if they had negative change from baseline, and "Stable" otherwise.
measure.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug and had data for FACT-Hep questionnaire.

outcome.title: Relationship of Steady-State Drug Levels to Clinical Outcomes of Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: OS was the duration from randomization to death from any cause. For participants who were alive at data cut-off, OS was censored at the last contact. Participants were categorized into 2 groups based on their steady state drug levels of Enzastaurin (total analyte=enzastaurin + LSN326020 [metabolite]): those participants below the median and those participants above the median [2786.042 nanomoles per /liter (nmol/l)]. The steady state drug levels and clinical outcomes were not evaluated for the Gemcitabine only treatment group.
outcome.time_frame: Randomization to date of death from any cause up to 27.7 months
outcome.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug. Participants censored: Below median = 4; Above median =4.

outcome.description: The overall disease control rate was calculated as percent of participants with overall response of complete response (CR), partial response (PR) or stable disease (SD) over number of per-protocol population. outcome.description: Clinically significant events were defined as SAEs and other non-serious adverse events (AEs). Participants who died due to progressive disease (PD), AEs while on treatment or died during the 30 day post-treatment are included. A summary of SAEs and other non-serious AEs regardless of causality is located in the Reported Adverse Events module.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline through study completion (Up To 27.7 Months)
outcome.population: Safety population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

group.title: Enzastaurin+Gemcitabine
group.description: Enzastaurin: 1200 milligrams (mg) administered orally (as three 400-mg doses) after a meal on Day 1, then 500 mg orally, daily (as five 100-mg tablets) after lunch on Days 2 to 28 in Cycle 1, then 500 mg orally, daily (as five 100-mg tablets) after lunch on Days 1 to 28 in Cycle 2 and later. Gemcitabine: 1000 milligrams/square meter (mg/m^2) administered intravenously on Days 1, 8 and 15 of each 28-day cycle.

group.title: Gemcitabine
group.description: Gemcitabine: 1000 mg/m^2 administered intravenously on Days 1, 8 and 15 of each 28-day cycle.

measure.title: Number of Participants Experiencing Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) and Adverse Events (AEs) (Toxicity)
measure.description: Clinically significant events were defined as SAEs and other non-serious adverse events (AEs). Participants who died due to progressive disease (PD), AEs while on treatment or died during the 30 day post-treatment are included. A summary of SAEs and other non-serious AEs regardless of causality is located in the Reported Adverse Events module.
measure.population: Safety population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

reported_events.desc: Study-specific clinical outcomes due to progressive disease were not considered to be serious adverse events (SAEs) unless it was deemed related to study drug by the investigator.

group.title: Enzastaurin+Gemcitabine
group.description: Enzastaurin: 1200 milligrams (mg) administered orally (as three 400-mg doses) after a meal on Day 1, then 500 mg orally, daily (as five 100-mg tablets) after lunch on Days 2 to 28 in Cycle 1, then 500 mg orally, daily (as five 100-mg tablets) after lunch on Days 1 to 28 in Cycle 2 and later. Gemcitabine: 1000 milligrams/square meter (mg/m^2) administered intravenously on Days 1, 8 and 15 of each 28-day cycle.

group.title: Gemcitabine
group.description: Gemcitabine: 1000 mg/m^2 administered intravenously on Days 1, 8 and 15 of each of each 28-day cycle.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
